description: Two parallel muted-colour variables exist — --muted (in :root) and --text-muted (in sl-theme-css) — with different names, different values, and no bridge. Elements using var(--muted) never receive a theme-adapted colour, while those using var(--text-muted) do.
likelyCause: The sl-theme-css system was added later to provide multi-theme support. It introduced its own --text-muted token without migrating the existing --muted usages.
fixDirection: Add --muted overrides to both sl-theme-css blocks: html[data-theme="dark"] { --muted: #909db5; } and html[data-theme="light"] { --muted: #5a6080; }. Resolves C-01 and most of C-05 in a two-line change.

description: No :focus-visible rule is defined. All interactive elements (nav links, tab buttons, build-summary selects, zoom buttons, Open links) rely on browser-default focus rings.
observedDifference: Focus ring style is inconsistent across element types and may clip inside rounded corners (border-radius on .tab-button, .artifact, .artifact-fold). No visual link to the page accent colour system.
likelyCause: Focus styling was not included when the page was built.
fixDirection: Add: a:focus-visible, button:focus-visible, select:focus-visible { outline: 2px solid var(--accent); outline-offset: 3px; } This binds focus rings to the accent colour (#5b9cf6 dark / #3362d0 light), both of which pass 3.0:1 non-text contrast.
